Based on your preferences, I recommend checking out "American Sniper" and "Windtalkers." Both movies are set during World War II and feature powerful performances from their actors. "American Sniper" stars Bradley Cooper as a Navy SEAL sniper who must come to terms with the horrors of war after serving four tours, while "Windtalkers" tells the story of two U.S. Marines who are assigned to protect Navajo Marines who use their native language as an unbreakable radio cypher. Both movies showcase the bravery and sacrifice of those who fought in this pivotal moment in history.

* "The River" (1991) is a documentary short film that explores the devastating effects of the Mississippi River system and highlights the need for more Federal projects to address these issues. * "In Time" (2011) is a thought-provoking sci-fi thriller starring Justin Timberlake and Olivia Wilde. Set in a future where people stop aging at 25, but are engineered to live only one more year, the film follows a young man accused of murder as he navigates a dangerous game of cat and mouse with corrupt authorities. With a talented cast and an intriguing premise, this movie is sure to keep you on the edge of your seat.
